name: Path N Stomach
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** Histological examination of a regional lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 16 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0.

**Note 2:**  Code only regional lymph nodes and lymph nodes, NOS in this field.  Distant lymph nodes are coded in distant metastasis.

**Note 3:** Assign N1 if regional lymph nodes are involved but there is no indication of the number of nodes involved.

**Note 4:**  Metastatic nodules in the fat adjacent to a gastric carcinoma, without evidence of residual lymph node tissue, are considered regional node metastases, but nodules implanted on peritoneal surfaces are considered distant metastases.

**Regional lymph nodes for Stomach are:**

    Celiac:
       Hepatic (excluding gastrohepatic) 
       Hepatoduodenal     
    Left gastric (superior gastric), NOS:
       Cardial
       Cardioesophageal
       Gastric, left
       Gastropancreatic, left
       Lesser curvature
       Lesser omental
       Paracardial
    Hepatoduodenal (for lesser curvature)  
    Nodule(s) in perigastric fat    
    Pancreaticosplenic (pancreaticolienal)
    Pancreaticoduodenal
    Perigastric, NOS
    Peripancreatic
    Right gastric (inferior gastric), NOS:
       Gastrocolic
       Gastroduodenal
       Gastroepiploic (gastro-omental), right or NOS
       Gastrohepatic
       Greater curvature
       Greater omental
       Pyloric, NOS: infrapyloric, subpyloric, suprapyloric
    Splenic (lienal), NOS:
        Gastroepiploic (gastro-omental), left
        Splenic hilar
  
    Regional lymph nodes, NOS
    Lymph nodes, NOS
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Unknown; regional lymph nodes not stated
Not documented in patient record

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1
Metastasis in 7 or more regional lymph nodes

Note: N3 has subcategories of N3a and N3b. Assign N3 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Stated as N3 [NOS]
Metastasis in 16 or more regional lymph nodes
